Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: We are going to create a DECLARE model for the given scenario We will define constraints that are typical for such a process and assign them support and confidence values Since the scenario is a typical product design and launch process we can assume that the constraints are always followed so support and confidence are 1.0

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Note The instructions say that for the first set of keys existence absence exactlyone init the value is a dictionary containing as keys the activities and as corresponding value the support 1.0 and confidence of the declarative rule For the second set of keys respondedexistence coexistence response precedence succession etc the value is a dictionary containing as keys the activities and as corresponding value the support 1.0 and confidence of the declarative rule

Name: Abductive Reasoning - PE
Text: for the second set the dictionary keys are the activities or more precisely the pair of activities and the value is the support and confidence Let me clarify with an example For response {Design Draft Technical Feasibility Check 1.0 1.0} But note the description says containing as keys the activities which might mean that for each constraint type we have a dictionary where the key is a string of the form activity1 activity2 or a tuple Since the example in the prompt for the second set does not specify the exact format I will use a string with two activities separated by a comma However looking at the pm4py documentation I see that for DECLARE constraints the keys are often strings of the form A B Lets assume that format

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Lets list the activities again for reference IG DD TFC CE PC LT UT AG MP FL Existence We require that each trace must contain at least one occurrence of an activity in each trace Example Every product must have an Idea Generation IG at least once Exactly one Each product idea goes through exactly one Approval Gate AG Init Every trace must start with Idea Generation IG

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: Now for the binary constraints We will define some typical ones respondedexistence If A occurs then B occurs example If Design Draft DD occurs then Technical Feasibility Check TFC must occur precedence A must occur before B example Approval Gate AG must occur before Final Launch FL response If A occurs then B must occur after A example If Prototype Creation PC occurs then Laboratory Testing LT must occur after PC succession A must occur and then B must occur after A example Idea Generation IG must be followed by Design Draft DD altresponse If A occurs then B must occur after A and no other A can occur until B occurs example If User Testing UT occurs then Approval Gate AG must occur after UT chainresponse If A occurs then B must occur immediately after A example After Cost Evaluation CE Prototype Creation PC must occur immediately

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Absence We might require that certain activities are absent in the entire trace Not typical for this process So we might leave absence constraints empty noncoexistence A and B cannot occur together example Idea Generation IG and Final Launch FL cannot occur in the same trace which makes sense because IG is at the beginning and FL at the end but they both occur so we dont want this constraint Instead we might not have noncoexistence constraints in this process

Name: Heuristic Reasoning - PE
Text: We are to create a dictionary with all the keys from the DECLARE model even if we dont have constraints for some of them We can leave them as empty dictionaries Well set support and confidence to 1.0 for all these constraints Steps 1 Create the dictionary with the required keys 2 For each constraint type well assign a dictionary of constraints with the constraint as key and a tuple support confidence as value Well use strings for the binary constraints eg Design Draft Technical Feasibility Check Lets code accordingly
